page.title: 20COMMUNITY COUNCIL
page.content: Braco & Greenloaning C.C. Following the re-organisation of Local Government, the Community Council was formed in 1977 to take the place of the Parish Council.It acts as a link between the public and the District & Regional Councils,having no power of its own.It comprises six members elected by the community it serves;the officials are the Chairman, Secretary and Treasurer.Meetings are held in the Kirk Hall for 7 months of the year,in Greenloaning School in June & January & in Braco Hall for the A.G.M.normally on the first Monday of the month. Close contact is maintained with District & Regional officials with responsibility for services in the area, and they have been helpful in dealing with problems brought to their notice by members of the community.
